intro: Lychnophora proteiformis, commonly known as the variable lychnophora, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. Its flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological role. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to survive.
